meanings.sent1: The embroilments in the office made it hard to get work done.
meanings.sent2: She found herself in a web of embroilments that she couldn't unravel.
meanings.sent3: The embroilments in the kitchen were so tangled, even the spaghetti looked simple.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a maze of embroilments, each thought leading to a dead end.
meanings.sent5: The embroilments of the plot kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: Her embroilments with the law led to a series of court appearances.
meanings.sent2: The company's financial embroilments were causing stress among the employees.
meanings.sent3: His embroilments with technology always ended with a broken device.
meanings.sent4: The embroilments in their relationship were like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The political embroilments of the country were front-page news every day.
